articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 42 people were killed in Israeli attacks on districts of Gaza City in the north of the Palestinian enclave on Saturday, the director of the Hamas-run government media office said.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill at least 42 in Gaza, enclave's government media office says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian guided bombs struck an apartment building in Ukraine's second largest city of Kharkiv, on Saturday, killing three people, injuring 29 and prompting President Volodymyr Zelenskiy to call for more help from Kyiv's allies.
articles.title: Russian bomb attack kills three, injures 29 in Ukraine's Kharkiv

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A nuclear-powered U.S. aircraft carrier, the Theodore Roosevelt, arrived in South Korea's port city of Busan on Saturday for joint military exercises this month with the host nation and Japan, South Korea's navy said.
articles.title: US aircraft carrier arrives in South Korea for military drills

articles.author: Praveen Paramasivam
articles.description: The death toll has climbed to 54 from consumption of tainted liquor in India's southern state of Tamil Nadu, with more than 100 people still in hospital, a government official said on Saturday.
articles.title: Death toll rises to 54 in India liquor tragedy

articles.author: Anita Komuves
articles.description: Carrying rainbow flags and dancing through the streets, thousands of Hungarians celebrated the annual Budapest Pride parade on Saturday and vowed to keep protesting over the government's anti-LGBTQ+ policies.
articles.title: Thousands join Budapest Pride to protest anti-LGBTQ+ policies

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least two people were killed and several wounded, including a police officer, in a shooting at a supermarket in Arkansas on Friday, local media reported.
articles.title: Two people killed, several wounded in shooting in Arkansas - media

articles.author: Nathan Layne
articles.description: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump will speak on Saturday to an influential group of conservative Christian activists who advocate for restricting abortion, before heading to Philadelphia for a rally aimed at courting Black voters.
articles.title: Trump to speak to Christian group, then court Black vote in Philadelphia

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hundreds of firefighters struggled on Saturday to contain wildfires fanned by gale force winds on two Greek islands and in other parts of Greece, as authorities warned many regions face a high risk of new blazes.
articles.title: Greece battles wildfires fanned by gale force winds

articles.author: Candelaria Grimberg
articles.description: Argentines, famed for steakhouses, sprawling cattle ranches and asado barbecues, are consuming less beef than ever, forced to tighten their belts by triple-digit inflation and a recession.
articles.title: Meat-loving Argentines eat less beef as inflation bites

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Egypt withdrew the operating licenses of 16 tourism companies and referred them to the public prosecutor, accusing them of being responsible for the deaths of Egyptian pilgrims in Mecca, a crisis unit tasked with addressing the situation said on Saturday.
articles.title: Egypt cracks down on tourism companies after haj deaths
